result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayonte M Lewis

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 01-12-22: GPS and house arrest  may be removed, Deft not to drive at all
NG plea entered.

9:43 AM Defendant Jayonte M Lewis appeared in court, Attorney Robert William Keller appeared in court for Jayonte M Lewis, Attorney Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense contests count 2. Defense moves to dismiss count 2 due to lack of probable cause.
State asks the court to take judicial notice. Chase was terminated. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense motions to modify bond.
State objects to allow driving

BTC: Motion to dismiss count 2 is denied. probable cause found. Judicial notice taken of speeds reached. Modify bond to eliminate house arrest. Deft not to drive at all.
Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
